messages.content:
(base) bilalghalib@macbook-pro parliament-chat-nextjs % npm install bootstrap@next @popperjs/core

npm ERR! code ETARGET
npm ERR! notarget No matching version found for bootstrap@next.
npm ERR! notarget In most cases you or one of your dependencies are requesting
npm ERR! notarget a package version that doesn't exist.

npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in:
npm ERR!     /Users/bilalghalib/.npm/_logs/2023-05-08T08_39_18_600Z-debug-0.log

The error message suggests that there is no matching version of the Bootstrap package with the "@next" tag in the npm registry. It could be that the "@next" tag is not supported by the Bootstrap package, or it might not have been published yet.

To resolve the issue, you can try installing the latest version of Bootstrap without the "@next" tag by running the following command:

```
npm install bootstrap @popperjs/core
```

This will install the latest stable version of Bootstrap and the Popper.js library. If you specifically need a pre-release version of Bootstrap, you can check the Bootstrap repository on GitHub to see if any pre-release versions are available.

The error message indicates that Next.js is unable to find the `Settings` component in the `../components/` directory. 

To resolve this error, you should check that you have created the `Settings.js` file in the `../components/` directory and have exported the `Settings` component correctly. 

You should also check that the path to the `Settings` component is correct. The path is relative to the file that is importing the `Settings` component, so make sure that the file structure is correct and that the `Settings` component is located in the correct directory.

If you have confirmed that the file structure and path are correct, you can try deleting the `node_modules` folder and running `npm install` again to ensure that all dependencies are installed correctly. 

If the issue persists, you can try clearing the cache by running the following command: 

```
npm cache clean --force
```

Then, restart the development server and see if the error is resolved.

The error message indicates that Next.js is unable to find the `react-bootstrap` module that is imported in the `Chat.js` file.

To resolve this error, you should first ensure that `react-bootstrap` is installed as a dependency. You can do this by running the following command in your project directory:

```
npm install react-bootstrap
```

If `react-bootstrap` is already installed, you should try deleting the `node_modules` folder and running `npm install` again to ensure that all dependencies are installed correctly.

If the issue persists, you should check that the import statement in `Chat.js` is correct and matches the exact module name. 

Finally, you should check that the path to `Chat.js` is correct in the file that is importing it (`index.js` in this case) and that the component is being imported correctly.
